greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals, where column k is the expansion of Product_{j>=1} 1/(1-x^j)^(j^(k*j)) in powers of x.
maple: A:= proc(n, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, add(add(
seq(seq(A(n, d-n), n=0..d), d=0..10);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 15 2017
mathematica: A[n_, k_] := If[n==0, 1, Sum[Sum[d*d^(k*d), {d, Divisors[j]}] *A[n - j, k], {j, n}] / n]; Flatten[Table[A[d - n,  n],{d, 0, 10},{n, d, 0, -1}]] (* _Indranil Ghosh_, Mar 17 2017 *)
program: (PARI) A(n, k) = if(n==0, 1, sum(j=1, n, sumdiv(j, d, d*d^(k*d)) * A(n - j, k))/n);
{for(d=0, 10, for(n=0, d, print1(A(n, d - n),", ");); print(););} \\ _Indranil Ghosh_, Mar 17 2017
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Mar 14 2017
